publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra (in texts IV, V and VI); numbers of the Psalms and other texts; traditional titles of the Psalms; titles, headings and incipits; in Ps. 118 – the name of each Hebrew letter and its interpretation, the number of the portion and its first line; abbreviations. The letters of the first word (ሰብሕዎ) in each line of Ps. 150 are written in alternating black and red ink.

msItem.note: - On fol. 133r l.12 a supplication for King Mǝnilǝk II has been added after Ps. 110 as its continuation, in the main hand: ስብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፨ ለዓለም፡ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፨ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ ማርያም። ምሕረተ፡ክርስቶስ፡ ወልድኪ፨ የሐውፀነ፡ እምአርያም፨ ኦአምላከ፡ ዳዊት፡ ዕቀቦ፡ለንጉሥነ፡ ምኒልክ፡

Glory be to the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit, for eternity. Pray for us, Holy Virgin Mary! May the mercy of Christ, your Son, reach us from the seventh heaven. O God of David! Protect our King Mǝnilǝk.

- Eight psalms are extended by a doxology and, occasionally, a supplication (Ps. 30, fol. 33r; Ps. 70, fol. 79v; Ps. 80, fol. 95r; Ps. 90, fol. 107r; Ps. 100, fol. 115v; Ps. 110, fol. 133r [identical to the previous one]; Ps. 120, fol. 150r [almost identical to the text after Ps. 80]; Ps. 130, fol. 154v).
- Text I-3 contains interlineally inserted verses from Songs of Solomon (so called “Hebrew version”). For more information s. Ms.DD-004‘Other details’.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 235.0 folios, of which blank 1rv, in 25.0 quires (A+24).
23.0 17.5 8.0

signatures.note: Undecorated quire marks are usually written in the left corner of the bottom margin of fols. 2r, 12r (in the upper margin), 22r, 32r, 42r, 52r, 62r, 72r, 82r, 92r, 102r, 112r, 122r, 132r, 142r, 152r, 162r, 172r, 182r, 210r.

layout.ab: Pricking is mostly visible; ruling is partly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Pricking is mostly visible; ruling is partly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote: Neat and careful Black, red Mäkonnän of Näḉḉ ŚarThe Ms. was probably written by qäññ geta Mäkonnän (sic for Mäkwännǝn)of Näḉḉ Śar (Wällo) from Mäkanä Sämaʿt, who produced also Ms. DD-004 (here, the colophon contains the scribe's name).Late 19th-early 20th century

decoDesc.decoNote: Fols. 2r, 11v, 22r, 33v, 48r, 59r, 67v, 80r, 95v, 107v, 116r, 133v, 150v, 163v (incipit page of the most ten-psalm units): coloured (crimson, yellow, light green) elaborate ornamental bands with lateral extensions; interlaces, floral motifs.
Fol. 172r (incipit page of Text I-2): coloured (crimson, yellow, light green) elaborate ornamental band with lateral extensions; interlaces, floral motifs.
Fol. 190r (incipit page of Text I-3): coloured (crimson, yellow, light green) elaborate ornamental bands with lateral extensions; interlaces, floral motifs.
Fol. 200r (incipit page of Text I-4): coloured (crimson, yellow, light green) elaborate ornamental bands with lateral extensions; interlaces, floral motifs.

list.item: Fols. 228vb-229rb: Concluding supplications for the donors. Fols. 228vb-229rb: ጸሎታ፡ ለማርያም፡ ወስእለታ፡ ለተክለ፡ ሚካ[sic] ፡ ያድኅኖ፡ እመዓተ፡ ወልዳ፨ ጸሎታ፡ ለማርያም፡ ወስእለታ፡ ለለወተ[sic]፡ ጊዮር[sic]፡ ያድኅና፡ እመዓተ፡ ወልዳ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ተክለ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ገብረ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ገብረ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወልደ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ገብረ፡ መድህን፡ ወለተ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ታድኅኖሙ፡ እመዓተ፡ ወልዳ፨ በ፲ወ፰፻፺ወ፫ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፨ ስብሐት፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ዘአብጽሐነ፡ እስከ፡ ዛቲ፡ ሰዓት፡ ወለወላዲቱ፡ ድንግል፡ ማርያም፡ ቅድስት፨ ወላዕሌነ፡ ይኩን፡ ሣህል፡ ወምሕረት፡ እስከ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ [Fols. 228vb-229rb]: May the prayers of Mary and her intercession for Täklä Mika[ʾel] save him from the wrath of her Son. May the prayers of Mary and her intercession for Wälättä Giyor[gis] save her from the wrath of her Son unto the ages of ages. Amen. Täklä Mikaʾel, Gäbrä Yoḥannǝs, Gäbrä Śǝllase, Gäbrä Krǝstos, Wäldä Śǝllase, Gäbrä Mädhǝn, Wälättä Giyorgis – may she save them from the wrath of her Son. In the year of mercy 1893. Glory be to God who made us live until this very hour, and to His Mother, the holy Virgin Mary. And may benevolence and mercy be upon us for ever and ever. Amen. The note is most probably written in the main hand. It is dated to 1893 year of mercy (= 1900/91 A.D.). Later on, a part of it has been erased and filled in with the names of Täklä Mikaʾel's family members.

Fols. 229va-230vb: Unidentified prayer in Amharic.Fol. 229va, l.1: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ኦእግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ ርኅሩኃ፡ ልብ፡ አድኅነኒ፡ አዳምን፡ ከሲኦል፡ ኖኅን፡ ከማየ፡ አይኅ፧ አብርሃምን፡ ከንጉሠ፡ ጌሬራ፡ ሎጥን፡ ከሰዶም፡ ከሰዶም፡ከገሞራ፨ ያዳንህ፡ አድኅነኒ፨ ... Fol. 230vb, l.7: ... እምቅድመ፡ አለም፡ የነበርክ፡ አለምን፡ አሳልፈህ፡ የምትኖር፡ መንግሥትህ፡ አይጐድል፡ ባንድነት፡ በ፫ትነት፡ የምትቀደስ፡ የምትሠለስ፨ አምላክ፡ መሐርኒ፡ ወኢትርሳአኒ፡ [Fol. 229va, l.1]: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. O God the Father, the merciful of heart, save me. You who have saved Adam from Sheol, Noah from the waters of the Flood, Abraham from the king of Gerar, Lot from Sodom, from Sodom and Gomorrah, save me… [Fol. 230vb, l.7]: ...you who had existed before the world; you who will live on after the world has passed away; you whose Kingdom will not suffer damage; you who are sanctified and [known] in three [Persons], in Unity and in Trinity – o God, have mercy on me and do not forget me. The prayer is written in the same poor hand as Additiones 3 and 5. Part of the incipit and nomina sacra are rubricated.

Fols. 231rb-232ra: Excerpts from the Gospel of Luke. Fol. 231vb-232ra: Lk. 1:38b-45, followed by words: ወበሳድስን፡ ድግም፨ Fol. 232rb: Lk. 1:56-57, followed by words: ጸሎተ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያምን፡ ድግም፨
The text is written in the same poor hand as Additiones 2 and 5. The text on fol. 231r faded out (?) and became unreadable.

Fol. 232rb: Donation note (?). Fol. 232rb, l.9: ዘዳዊት፡ ዘባራስ፡ ዋሴ፡ ወልደ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወለተ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ወለተ፡ ንጉስ፡ ዘሚካኤል፡ ተክለ፡ ሐይማኖት፡ እግዚኦ፡ አዕርፍ፡ ነበሰ[sic]፡ ወወልደ፡ ሚኤል[sic]፡ ገብረ፡ ኢየስ[sic]፡ ወለተ፡ ማርያም፡ ወልደ፡ ፊልጶስ፡ ገበረ[sic]፡ ተክለ፡ ሐይማኖት፡ ወለተ፡ ኪዳን፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖሙ፡ መርሃ፡ለመንግስተ፡ ሰማያት፡ የሰጡት፡ ጥር፡ 24፡ 83 ዓ፡ም
Written in pen, in a recent hand.

Fols. 232v-235v: Mälkǝʾa Gäbrǝʾel “Image of Gäbrǝʾel” (incomplete).
The text is written in the same poor hand as Additiones 2 and 3. Part of incipit, nomina sacra and the first word of each strophe (ሰላም፡...) are rubricated. Cp. Säbattu kidanat. Qǝddase Maryam. Mälkǝʾa gubaʾe, Addis Abäba, 1959 A.M. 312-323.

- The title of the work, ዳዊት, is crudely written in green paint on the back board. - An inscription ከሽ፱ ዓ ም መልአከ ሰላም ተክለ ሚካኤል ዳዊት is crudely written in red pencil on fol. 1r. - The midpoint of the “Psalms of David” is marked on fol. 88r. - Correction written over erasure: fol. 67r. - Correction indicated by thin lines above and below the word: fols. 84v, 85v. - Omitted letters, words or passages are written interlineally, in the main hand: fols. 14v, 21r, 45r, 55v, 60r, 69r, 105r, 121v, 218rb, 223ra. - Erasures marked with thin lines: fols. 12r, 23r, 35r, 76v, 125r, 142v, 143r, 144r, 144v, 154r, 209r. - Part of the line is taken up: fols. 4v, 26r, 27v, 72r, 76v, 136r. - Part of the line is taken down: fol. 28v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

Blind tooled ornament on the reddish leather cover (at least 7 tools were used: fourfold line fillet, double circle, small x, corni form, leaf form, round celtic knot, double sine wave with dots, criss-cross).

origin.origDate: According to Additio 1, most probably written in the main hand, the Ms. was produced in 1893 year of mercy (= 1900/01 A.D.). Additionally, King Mǝnilǝk (r. 1889-1913) is mentioned in the supplication on fol. 133r.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: The name of the original donor has been erased from Additio 1 and replaced with the name of Täklä Mikaʾel and his family members. Their names are also written on fols. 199v, 226vb and in Additio 2, in the same poor hand as Additio 1. Later, according to Additio 4, the Ms. belonged to one Wäldä Mikaʾel and his family who donated the book in 1983 year of mercy (= 1991 A.D.)

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
